meta.title: Home - Regional School District #16

li.a: CT State Standards and Smarter Balanced Testing Information

p.a: April 22nd Board of Education YouTube LiveStream

hr.p: Meet the Helpers- (Video and toolkit for younger children to introduce the "helpers" and explain the role they play in emergency situations)

section.class: fsElement fsNews fsSlideshow fsItemCount_9 fsSlideshowHorizontal fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailMedium

p.span: LRMS Cheerleading is back and it took no time to have a successful season! Coaches Crystal Periera and Denise Tafuto have worked hard with a group of 21 cheerleaders. This season they placed 2nd at the Wolcott Competition, 4th place at Junior NVLs
and took home the SPIRIT AWARD, and 3rd place at the Woodland Cheerfest. Way to go Wildcats!

img.alt: One Region, One Book Event at LRMS

div.a: One Region, One Book Event at LRMS

p.span: Over 50 Long River students stayed after school on February 27th to take part in the One Region, One Book event to celebrate The Little Prince by Antoine de Saint-Exupery. Students engaged in several kindness and community service activities including:

li.span: Writing Positive Post its for Lockers
Making oral hygiene bags for St. Vincent de Paul

img.alt: NJHS & PES Read Across America Day

div.a: NJHS & PES Read Across America Day

span.img: Long River's National Junior Honor Society visited Prospect Elementary School for their annual Read Across America event. NJHS members visited the elementary classes to read their favorite picture books. Another wonderful R16 event!

img.alt: Father returns home from tour in Cuba to see his girls!

div.a: Father returns home from tour in Cuba to see his girls!

div.p: Glen Franoeur returned home on January 30, 2020 to see his girls! Thank you for your Service!!

img.alt: 100th Day of School at Laurel Ledge!

div.a: 100th Day of School at Laurel Ledge!

div.div: Congratulations to the LRMS Boys and Girls Swim Teams! Each team came in 3rd place and overall as a team finished in 3rd place. Several personal bests and school records were set:
Girls 400 Free Relay - new record of 4:03.11
1. Emme Starzman 2. Josie Nesta 3. Sarah Harlow 4. Laura DeGennaro
Boys 200 Medley Relay - new record of 2:05.39
1. Alex Weisenbacher 2. Chase Starzman 3. Nolan Bernier 4. Ryan Iannone
Boys 400 Free Relay - new record of 4:09.53
1. Chase Starzman 2. Ryan Iannone 3. Nolan Bernier 4. Alex Weisenbacher
Girls 50 Free - new record (since 2008) - 26.04 - EMME STARZMAN
Girls 50 Breast - new record - (beat her old one again this year) 32.12 - Emme Starzman
Girls 100 Free - new record - 56.36 Laura DeGennaro
Girls 50 Back - new record - 30.35 Laura DeGennaro
Boys 50 Back - new record - 30.08 Alex Weisenbacher

div.p: 1st time in Woodland history, WRHS Dance Team are NVL Champions!!

img.alt: Special Surprise for Laurel Ledge Student!

div.a: Special Surprise for Laurel Ledge Student!

div.p: Army Specialist Paul Brewer surprised his daughter Niamh at Laurel Ledge Elementary today, he returned from a 10 month assignment in Cuba.

div.div: GYM & Cafeteria
Media Center
Laurel Ledge Elementary
